organization.description: The Federal Laboratory Consortium for Technology Transfer (FLC) is the nationwide network of federal laboratories that provides the forum to develop strategies and opportunities for linking laboratory mission technologies and expertise with the marketplace.
organization.title: Federal Laboratory Consortium
organization.name: federal-laboratory-consortium

name: distributed-software-testing-and-integration-laboratory-stil
notes: The Distributed Software Testing and Integration Laboratory (D-STIL) located at EPG Headquarters in Ft. Huachuca; provides Software Testing, Verification and Validation (V&amp;V), and System Integration services to EPG customers. D-STIL Services include but are not limited to:  COTS and GOTS evaluation services for best of breed technology solutions for use for testing and/or implementation on Army networks  Security Compliance Testing Requirements Validation Testing Distributed and Isolated Software Testing  Performance Testing Scalability/Capacity Testing Functionality Testing Integration Testing Regression Testing   Verification and Validation (V&amp;V) Acceptance Testing Quality Assurance/Control The D-STIL has a persistent connection to EPG&#39;s Cyber/IA Test Facility; Joint Staff J6 C4 Assessment Division Laboratory in Suffolk, VA and has the ability to connect to Ft Hood, TX; APG, MD and more via the EPG Test Instrumentation/Test Analysis Network (TITAN). The EPG Joint Tool Suite (JTS) integrated with COTS test tools are used for software testing within the D-STIL. Assets such as the Cyber Integrated Test Suite (CITS) and Breaking Point are integrated into the distributed architecture through the Cyber/IA Test Facility. These unique capabilities allow for security, scalability, stress and performance testing all in a virtual environment. Additionally; the D-STIL provides help desk and customer support for the EPG JTS.  Remember: Please use the Instrumentation Helpdesk ( usarmy.huachuca.atec.list.epg-instrumentation-help-desk@mail.mil; 520-538-5602) for all instrumentation technical support. They will get you in contact with a lab technician or developer if required.
title: Distributed Software Testing and Integration Laboratory (STIL)
